abstract: The American International Group’s Asian life insurance unit flagged a series of business risks including the collapsed bid from a British rival, Prudential, as it launched its share offering on Tuesday, Reuters said.
snippet: The American International Group’s Asian life insurance unit flagged a series of business risks including the collapsed bid from a British rival, Prudential, as it launched its share offering on Tuesday, Reuters said.
lead_paragraph: The American International Group‘s Asian life insurance unit, which plans to raise up to $14.9 billion from its initial public offering, flagged a series of business risks including the collapsed bid from a British rival, Prudential, as it launched the share offering on Tuesday, Reuters said.

headline.main: A.I.A. Lists Risks as It Launches $15 Billion I.P.O.
